main.title: Let your child’s potential bloom!
main.subtitle: At Les Petits Bilingues de Newham, we nurture curiosity and a love for the French language from an early age. Each child grows at their own pace, guided by fun and immersive teaching methods in a nurturing and natural environment.

1.title: Exploring French like a gardener exploring their world!
1.subtitle: In this class, the little ones begin their linguistic journey. Just like young sprouts, they discover French through games, songs, and stories. We encourage their natural curiosity, gently guiding them to flourish at their own pace in a kind and nurturing environment.

2.title: Taking the first solid steps in the language!
2.subtitle: Young clovers are starting to take root in the French language. Through fun and interactive activities, they learn to construct simple sentences and express themselves with more confidence. This is the stage where they begin to trust themselves and start to bloom in their journey of learning French.

3.title: Flourishing and first conversations!
3.subtitle: Young flowers are truly beginning to blossom. Here, they refine their skills in listening comprehension and oral expression. We guide them through more structured discussions, creative activities, while strengthening their mastery of the written language. French becomes an exciting adventure full of discoveries!

4.title: Soaring towards a deeper mastery!
4.subtitle: Our young leaves are about to fully spread their wings. At this stage, students work on advanced French language skills. Discussions, projects, and cultural workshops help them naturally and fluently embrace the language. They are ready to connect with the Francophone world, while developing their critical and creative thinking skills.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: We’ve gathered the answers to the most common questions we receive. If you don’t find the information you’re looking for, don’t hesitate to contact us directly!

1.title: Who can enroll in the courses?
1.desc: Our courses are open to French-speaking children aged 3 to 16 who wish to maintain their French language skills and stay connected to French culture.

2.title: My child doesn’t speak French fluently, is that a problem?
2.desc: Not at all! Our courses are adapted to all levels of French, from children who understand but don’t speak much to those who are more advanced.

3.title: What are the class schedules?
3.desc: Classes take place every Saturday, with times adapted to each child’s age and level.

4.title: Where are the classes held?
4.desc: Classes take place at a dedicated center in [insert location], easily accessible from various areas.

5.title: What should my child bring to class?
5.desc: Your child will need a notebook, pens, and any other educational materials provided by the teacher at the start of the year.

6.title: What are the course fees?
6.desc: Our fees vary depending on the number of children enrolled per family and the level of the course. For more details, please consult our Fees page or contact us directly.

7.title: How are the levels organized?
7.desc: Children are grouped by age and language proficiency so that everyone can progress at their own pace.

8.title: Are there any activities outside of the classes?
8.desc: Yes, we regularly organize cultural activities to allow children to further explore French culture while having fun!
